item.title: 1. api/feedtest image list expansion test case
item.description: This test case contains three image enclosures. In the http://friendfeed.com/api/feedtest two are shown, and the third one should be shown after the user clicks the "expand" icon next to the two shown images. Yet, when the user does click on the expand icon, an error is thrown and the remaining image is not shown.

item.title: 2. visibility and autoresize for single image with no height/width set test case
item.description: This test case contains a single image enclosure which doesn't have an image height and width set. Friendfeed parses the enclosure and shows the image in http://friendfeed.com or http://friendfeed.com/api/feedtest. In addition, the image is automatically resized to the FF maximum height and width for images (175/525), and this is done not by setting the height and width parameters of the rendered IMG tag, but by setting the max-height and max-width attributes of the IMG tag.

item.title: 3. automatic resizing of oversized images with height/width set test case
item.description: This test case includes a single image enclosure which has it's height/width attributes set. However, the image is larger than the maximum allowed, so the image is automatically resized. The interesting thing is that this is not done by resizing the image to the maximum allowed dimensions (525/175), but by halving the image dimensions several times. So, in result the image is rendered smaller than it could be with a smarter resizing method, as in test case number 2.

item.title: 4. multiple images with at least one image with no height/width image set test case
item.description: This test case contains three image enclosures, two which do not have their height/width attributes set, and one that does. In http://friendfeed.com or http://friendfeed.com/api/feedtest only two images are shown - the first image without height/width attributes is shown (other images witout height/width attributes are not shown) and all images which do have height/width attributes set.
